committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Europe and the Middle East

official_title: A resolution to express the sense of the House of Representatives that the United States shall maintain its commitment to the security of the State of Israel and that the President should repudiate certain actions of the Secretary of Interior.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the House of Representatives that the United States shall maintain its commitment to the security of the State of Israel and that the President should repudiate a certain letter sent by Secretary of State James Watt to the Israeli ambassador to the United States concerning the effect on U.S.-Israeli relations of opposition by the American Jewish community to the Reagan administration's energy policies.

titles.title: A resolution to express the sense of the House of Representatives that the United States shall maintain its commitment to the security of the State of Israel and that the President should repudiate certain actions of the Secretary of Interior.
